channel.title: Mother left newborn in Wal-Mart toilet
channel.description:
Mother who left newborn in Wal-Mart toilet not guilty A woman who gave birth in a Wal-Mart washroom in Prince Albert, Sask., and left the baby behind has been found not guilty of child abandonment, a judge has ruled. Queen's Bench Justice Neil Gabrielson released his decision Wednesday in the case of April Dawn Halkett, 22. He said the Crown didn't prove its case, and that while what Halkett did was negligent and inappropriate, it was not criminal. Halkett rested her head on one of her hands while the decision was read. She didn't react when Gabrielson said she was not guilty. During her judge-alone trial in May, Halkett testified that she did not realize she was pregnant when she went to use the store's washroom during a shopping trip in May 2007. ...
source: http://www.cbc.ca/canada/saskatchewan/story/2009/06/24/halkett-decision.html wtf

item.title: Mother left newborn in Wal-Mart toilet
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

[quote=“sanga282, post:10, topic:285225”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=376957.msg2840550#msg2840550 date=1245946098]
Some women do not gain much weight at all when pregnant.

Some women continue to have their period through pregnancy, and some women have irregular/no period anyway.

It happens, some people get pregnant without knowing right up until delivery.

What I wanna know though, is how the hell did she GIVE BIRTH without knowing Or am I missing something
[/quote]
she thought it was a big shit?[/quote]
Out of her vagina?

item.title: Mother left newborn in Wal-Mart toilet
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Tenac:

When her water broke, what did that make her think, along with missing a period for 9 months and gaining 10 pounds, and in addition when she gave birth, she had to cut the umbilical cord I bet and just left it there on purpose.

Plus a pregnant woman is going to gain a lot more than 10 pounds.

That verdict is ridiculous, maybe someone should leave that judge in a bathroom toilet.
